test_cases.objective: Verify that the Environmental Monitoring System accurately measures and records temperature within specified tolerances.

test_steps.action: Set up reference thermometer adjacent to EMS probe in controlled environment
test_steps.expected_result: Both sensors are positioned to measure identical conditions

test_steps.action: Stabilize environment at 5°C and maintain for 30 minutes
test_steps.expected_result: Environment reaches stable temperature within tolerance

test_steps.action: Record simultaneous readings from EMS and reference thermometer at 5-minute intervals for 1 hour
test_steps.expected_result: All EMS readings within ±0.5°C of reference

acceptance_criteria: All temperature measurements within ±0.5°C of reference
Data recording interval maintained at 5 minutes
data_integrity_requirements: All data points must be recorded with timestamp
No gaps in data recording permitted

test_cases.objective: Verify that the system correctly generates alerts when temperature deviates beyond configured limits.

test_steps.action: Gradually increase temperature from 25°C to 27.1°C over 15 minutes
test_steps.expected_result: Alert generated when temperature reaches 27°C

test_steps.action: Verify alert appears in system console and audit log
test_steps.expected_result: Alert properly recorded with timestamp and value

test_steps.action: Repeat test for low temperature deviation (22.9°C)
test_steps.expected_result: Alert generated at 23°C

acceptance_criteria: Alerts generated within 1 minute of threshold breach
All alerts properly recorded in audit trail
data_integrity_requirements: Alert must include exact deviation value
Alert timestamp must match data point timestamp

test_cases.test_name: Environmental Monitoring System - Temperature Accuracy Verification
test_cases.objective: Verify that the Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) accurately measures temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with an accuracy of ±0.5°C.
prerequisites: Test environment prepared with controlled temperature settings

test_steps.action: Set the test environment to -80°C using the calibrated reference device.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature within -80.5°C to -79.5°C.

test_steps.action: Set the test environment to +50°C using the calibrated reference device.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature within +49.5°C to +50.5°C.

acceptance_criteria: EMS temperature readings are within ±0.5°C of the reference device readings at both test points.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all temperature readings are recorded and stored in the vendor's standard database format.

test_cases.test_name: Environmental Monitoring System - Alert Generation Verification
test_cases.objective: Verify that the Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) generates alerts when the temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint.
prerequisites: Test environment prepared with controlled temperature settings

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to 25°C in the EMS.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays the setpoint as 25°C.

test_steps.action: Increase the test environment temperature to 27.1°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alert indicating a temperature deviation.

test_steps.action: Decrease the test environment temperature to 22.9°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alert indicating a temperature deviation.

acceptance_criteria: EMS generates alerts when the temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all alerts are recorded and stored in the vendor's standard database format.

test_cases.objective: To ensure the Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) continuously monitors temperature as per URS-EMS-001 and URS-EMS-002.

test_steps.action: Set up temperature sensors in a controlled environment.
test_steps.expected_result: Sensors detect and display temperature readings.

test_steps.action: Monitor temperature readings for 24 hours.
test_steps.expected_result: Temperature readings are recorded at intervals not exceeding 5 minutes.

acceptance_criteria: Temperature readings are continuous and within specified intervals.
Data is accurately recorded and stored.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure data is not altered or lost during recording.

test_cases.test_name: Validate Alert Generation for Temperature Deviations
test_cases.objective: To verify that the EMS generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint as per URS-EMS-005.

test_steps.action: Set temperature setpoint to 25°C.
test_steps.expected_result: Setpoint is successfully configured.

test_steps.action: Simulate temperature deviation to 27°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alert for temperature deviation.

acceptance_criteria: Alerts are generated within specified deviation limits.
Alert messages are clear and actionable.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure alerts are logged in the audit trail.
Verify alert data is not lost.

test_cases.objective: To verify that the Environmental Monitoring System accurately records temperature within the specified range and accuracy.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature sensor to a known value using a calibrated reference.
test_steps.expected_result: The EMS system should display the temperature within ±0.5°C of the reference value.

acceptance_criteria: Temperature readings must be within ±0.5°C of the reference value
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all temperature data is stored securely and cannot be altered

test_cases.test_name: Validate Alert Generation for Temperature Deviations
test_cases.objective: To validate that the EMS system generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation of +2.5°C from the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: The EMS system should generate an alert indicating a temperature deviation.

acceptance_criteria: Alerts must be generated within 1 minute of the deviation
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure alerts are logged and cannot be deleted

test_cases.objective: To verify that the Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) accurately monitors and records temperature within the specified range and accuracy.
prerequisites: Test environment set to known temperature

test_steps.action: Set the test environment to a known temperature within the range of -80°C to +50°C.
test_steps.expected_result: The EMS system should display the temperature within ±0.5°C of the known value.

test_steps.action: Record the temperature reading from the EMS system at 5-minute intervals for 30 minutes.
test_steps.expected_result: All recorded temperatures should be within ±0.5°C of the known value.

acceptance_criteria: All temperature readings are within ±0.5°C of the known value.
Temperature readings are recorded at intervals not exceeding 5 minutes.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all temperature data is accurately recorded and stored.
Verify that the audit trail captures all temperature readings.

test_cases.test_name: Verify EMS Alert Generation for Temperature Deviation
test_cases.objective: To verify that the Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) generates alerts when the temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint.
prerequisites: Test environment set to known temperature

test_steps.action: Set the test environment to a temperature 2°C above the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: The EMS system should generate an alert indicating a temperature deviation.

test_steps.action: Set the test environment to a temperature 2°C below the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: The EMS system should generate an alert indicating a temperature deviation.

acceptance_criteria: Alerts are generated when the temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint.
Alerts are recorded in the system's audit trail.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all alerts are accurately recorded and stored.
Verify that the audit trail captures all alert events.
